data.nepali:
अध्याय ३१: संख्याको अनुक्रम

ठूला विचारहरु:

-         संख्याको आरोही क्रम

-         संख्याहरूको अवरोही क्रम


मार्गनिर्देशन प्रश्नहरू:

तपाइँ कसरी संख्याहरूको समूहबाट सबैभन्दा ठूलो नम्बर फेला पार्नुहुन्छ?

तपाइँ कसरी संख्याको समूहबाट सबैभन्दा सानो नम्बर फेला पार्नुहुन्छ?

data.html:
Order of Numbers Lesson

How do you put a set of 3 numbers in ascending order?
 descending?

How do you put a set of more than 3 numbers in
ascending order? descending?

Ascending: smallest to largest
Descending: largest to smallest
data.nepali:
पढे पछि

 तपाईंले ३ अंकको समूहबाट अंकलाई कसरी बढ्दो क्रममा वा घट्दो क्रममा राख्नुहुन्छ?


 तपाईंले ३ अंकको समूहभन्दा बढि अंकलाई कसरी बढ्दो क्रममा वा घट्दो क्रममा राख्नुहुन्छ?


आरोही: सबैभन्दा सानोदेखि ठूलोसम्म

अवरोही: सबैभन्दा ठूलोदेखि सानोसम्म

data.html:
Lesson Answers 

How do you put a set of 3 numbers in ascending order?
 descending?

1) find the smallest and the largest number
2) if ascending, put the smallest number first, the middle
number second, and the largest number last
3) if descending, put the largest number first, the middle
 number second, and the smallest number last
data.nepali:
उत्तरहरू पढ्दै

तपाईंले ३ अंकको समूहबाट अंकलाई कसरी बढ्दो क्रममा वा घट्दो क्रममा कसरी राख्नुहुन्छ?

 

१)  सबैभन्दा सानो र सबैभन्दा ठूलो संख्या फेला पार्नुहोस् ।

 

  २)  यदि आरोहण भएमा, सबैभन्दा सानो नम्बर अगाडि राख्नुहोस्, मध्य नम्बर दोस्रो, 

र सबैभन्दा ठूलो संख्या अन्तिममा लेख्नुहोस् ।

 

 ३)  यदि अवतरण भएमा, सबैभन्दा पहिले नम्बर राख्नुहोस्, मध्यम नम्बर दोस्रो, 

र सबैभन्दा सानो संख्या अन्तिममा लेख्नुहोस् ।

data.html:
Lesson Answers Cont. 

How do you put a set of more than 3 numbers in
ascending order? descending?

1) repeat step one from the previous slide
2) find the largest and smallest of the middle numbers
3) keep going till all numbers have been ordered
3) put in order, ascending or descending
data.nepali:
जवाफहारु

 

तपाईंले ३ अंक वा ३ अंक भन्दा बढि समूहको अंकलाई कसरी बढ्दो क्रममा वा 

घट्दो क्रममा कसरी राख्नुहुन्छ?

 

१)  सबैभन्दा सानो र सबैभन्दा ठूलो संख्या फेला पार्नुहोस् ।

२)  मध्यम संख्याको सब भन्दा ठूलो र सानो फेला पार्नुहोस् ।

३)  सबै नम्बरहरूको क्रम नमिलेसम्म जारी राख्नुहोस् ।

४)  क्रममा राख्नुहोस्, आरोही वा अवरोही ।

data.html:
Practice 

Order the following sets of numbers in ascending order:
1) 15, 4, 21
2) 56, 23, 11
3) 6, 3, 8

Order the following sets of numbers in descending order:
1) 12, 6, 32
2) 7, 37, 67
3) 7, 4, 9
data.nepali:
अभ्यास गर्नुहोस्

संख्याको समूहबाट संख्यालाई आरोही क्रममा मिलाउनुहोस् गर्नुहोस्:

१) १५, ४, २१

२) ५६, २३, ११

३) ६, ३, ८

संख्याको समूहबाट संख्यालाई अवरोही क्रममा मिलाउनुहोस् गर्नुहोस्:

१)   १२, ६, ३२

1) 15, 4, 21     4, 15, 21

data.html:
Finding Looma Resources 


Students learn better when they are engaged and challenged.

Discussion 

What do you know about Looma?

Finding Looma Resources  
1) Introduction: learn lesson topic  & its relevance
2) Objectives: what you will learn & do by the end of the lesson
3) Vocabulary: learn words & definitions relating to the lesson
4) Instruction: learn new information, concepts, & skills
5) Reinforcement & Expansion of Learning: practice for deep
   memory & understanding: apply, analyze, evaluate, & create 
   with videos, games, simulations, puzzles, creative tasks, & more
6) Assessment: demonstrate achievement of objectives
7) Reflection: share thoughts & feelings about the lesson
Active learning: KWL, Pair-Share, Thumbs Up, Games

Look at the next three pictures of students in class 

Which class is more engaged in learning?

The Power of Looma is Looma Lessons 

Looma Lessons enhance the textbook chapters
by adding related media and resource activities.

Resources include:  
VIDEOS, GAMES, PICTURES, & SIMULATIONS


These resources actively engage students and strengthen learning.

Introduction 

Who is interested in finding resources for Looma lessons?
                        Thumbs up for YES, 
                        Thumbs down for NO
                        Thumbs sideways for MAYBE
                          (T. models actions).

Following is a lesson plan for this session about resources.The lesson plan is a series of slides. 
You will be finding resources for lessons.
Let's explore Looma to become familiar how to find resources.
You will see the slide that corresponds to the part of the lesson 
we are on.

Introduction, continued 
W
In this lesson, YOU will discover how good resources
can make learning stronger AND more enjoyable.


Keep in mind that some of the most effective resources 
are ones you might help create yourself.

What do you think makes a good resource?

Adding new resources to Looma 
W
If you want to add a resource that is not already in Looma:
 
- Give the team leader the URL of the resource on the Internet
and the grade, subject and chapter for the resource

If you want a new game resource:

- Talk to your team leader about how to create a new Looma game

Objectives 

1. Describe contents of each Looma resource ( vocabulary slide):
    PhET,    TED,    ePaath,    Wikipedia, 
CK-12 (Dr Dann),      Hesperian,      Khan

2. Locate Looma resources on Looma website:
   - Library
   - Toolbar

3. Judge quality of Looma resources from the website 
     & from a lesson

Vocabulary: Free Educational Resources on Looma Website

1. CK-12 (DrDann):    textbooks, videos, exercises, real-world 
   application for over 5000 concepts
2. PhET:        science & math activities, labs
3. TED-Ed:         education videos
4. ePaath:   interactive digital learning, grades 1-8,
                 Science, Math, English, Nepali
5.  Khan:    videos, courses for many subjects 
6. Wikipedia:      online encyclopedia
7. Hesperian:   health education materials
8. CEHRD:   Ctr. for Ed. & Human Resources, Nepal
Other vocabulary:  1. criteria- standard for judging
                     2. consensus- general agreement

Gathering Resources 
.
1. Look at the Looma Website Home Page.
2. Click on a subject and grade.
3. Find columns:  CHAPTERS, LESSONS, RESOURCES

All resources you find for a chapter go into it's  "Resources" folder.

A volunteer teacher will make a lesson 
using the chapter's resources you find.

Reinforcement & Extension of Learning: 
evaluate resources in lessons (optional) 

Let's explore some resources. What makes a good resource?

Students in 3's discuss and then score each resource.
1 (below average), 2 (average), 3 (above average)

  In class discussion, why did you score the way you did?

Example of a Looma Game 

Looma games are a good way to involve students in their learning.

When they are having fun, they learn better.

What games have helped you learn?

Instruction: Resources on Looma website 


1. Take a brief 'tour' of the icons in the Looma toolbar:

Library, Search, Paint, Clock, Maps, History, Games, Calculator.

All  vocabulary words and resources are found 
in the "Library".

2. Explore Library; can you identify its contents?

How to find Looma resources for a chapter 
1. Know your chapter:
        - read the chapter
        - write down the main topics and words of the chapter

2. Look through the Looma Library for resources related to your 
   chapter
        - use the Looma Library page
        - open relevant folders and explore the contents
        - use the Library Search page
        - select keywords that describe the chapter
        - use the chapter's main topics as search terms

Special techniques for resource finding 

1. Open the Wikipedia folder in Looma Library
       - use the Wiki "search" functions to find relevant articles
2. Open the ePaath folder in Looma Library
       - select grade and subject to find relevant ePaath activities
3. For Physics and Math chapters, open the PhET folder 
       - look for relevant PhET simulations
4. Open other folders like "videos", "pictures", "TED"
                        
                       EXPLORE!!!!

Guidelines for resources for chapters 
INCLUDE
-->  EACH chapter - at least 5  different resources
      videos, games, PhET simulations, pictures, short courses

      (Some chapters may have 20 or more resources)

-->  Grades 1 to 4 -  1 or 2 games each

-->  Most chapters up to grade 8 - ePaath

-->  Most grades 9-12 Science & Math chapters  - PhET

Games are good resources 

Games are very popular and engaging for younger students.

Explore the Looma Games that are already on Looma.

To make a new game for your chapter, 
tell your leader what type of game with 
 prompts and responses.

Game types:  matching, multiple choice, concentration.

You can get any game made for your chapter.

The next few slides are examples of resources for lessons

    Videos            ePaaths        Maps             PhETs
                 Games                            PDFs
1. Does the resource invite students to participate?

2. Does the resource require thinking, problem solving, creating,
    analyzing, applying? How do you know?

 All students rate the resource on each of the following slides. 
      1 finger = below average,
      2 fingers = average
      3 fingers = above average

Resource  

Teacher will count # of 1's, 2's 3's from resource on previous 
slide.  
         Discuss as a class.

        What makes a good resource?  Brainstorm.

In a small group, come up with 3 criteria.
    -Groups share criteria with class.
    -Class vote decides final criteria.
    -Use final criteria to rate remaining resources.

Process for gathering resources 

Divide up into small teams.
Your leader will select a textbook chapter for each team.

Do you remember the procedures you have learned to find 
resources for your team's chapter?
1. Read the chapter
2. Write down important words for chapter's concepts & vocabulary
3. Search Looma Library for Resources using these words
4. Assess quality for deep active learning
5. Report resource selections to the team leader



Report your resource choices to Diksha (see next slide).

Reporting resource selections 

Team leader will keep a spreadsheet of all the resource selections.

When you have all the selections for a chapter, report them to her.

Write these down for the team leader:
      1. Resource name, filetype, appropriate grade levels 

      2. Chapter grade, subject, and chapter title or number

Assessment- What have you learned? 
Can You...

During the Lesson -
Give correct answers on vocabulary game 
Use criteria to rate and choose effective resources 

Future Assessment
Find and/or create relevant, engaging, challenging resources
 Find and/or create enough resources for effective learning

Reflection 

Write your answers to these questions, 
then share in groups of 2-3.
1. Do you feel ready to search for resources? Thumbs up or down?
2. What would help you to be more ready?
3. When looking for resources, how would you prefer to work?
    a. alone
    b. with a partner
    c. with a small group
4. Do you have a preference for subject and/or grade level? if so, 
    state your preferences.

Lesson Credits 


           Made by: Diksha, Joanna, and Joan        Date: 231108

           Translated by: first name(s).      Date: YYMMDD

1EN Phonics letter Hh endings  
We will learn about how English uses h at the end of words!
What words do you already know about with h at the end?
                          In Nepali?
                Record answers together on the board.
  
Objectives - what you will learn and be able to do.
1. Hear and repeat the different sounds of h at the end of words
2. Listen,  say, and write words with h at the end.
3. Listen, say and write words using the different h sound blends  
     (th,sh,ch,gh,ph) in lots of English words.

Vocabulary-1
Here are h sounds at end of words:  h (huffing sound)

Blended letter sounds using h: 
sh (shhhhh)    ch (like a choo choo train)  th (tongue between teeth)
           ph (sounds like f)    gh (silent or "F" ending)
Discover words ending in h.
As in Nepali, words ending in h are often very quiet or soft.

Find out what these words sound like. What do they mean?
ACT THESE OUT IN SMALL SKITS

Vocabulary-1
Here are h sounds at end of words:
h (huffing sound) 

Here are some words to discover ending in h.
Like in Nepali, words ending h are often very quiet or soft.

Find out what these words sound like. What do they mean?
 
EXPRESSIVE WORDS: AH   OH   EH...  UH?   UGH!

Exploring Vocabulary: h at the end of words 

A few words used often alone have h at the end. Let's look.
Ha-What you might say when you are happy or surprised.
Ah- What you might say when you are pleased or excited.
Oh- What you might say when you are surprised, have a question,
      or have learned something new.
Ugh- What you say when you are not happy. (sounds like hard G)

Make up a story and act it out to your class. 
 Can they guess?

Vocabulary-2: SH 
Review  h sounds at end of words:
h (huffing sound)    sh (shhhhh)                  ch (like a train)
gh (silent ending)    th (tongue between teeth)  ph (sounds like f)

    Let's find words ending in blended SH. It sounds like shhhhhhh.
Make a game of these in pairs.        Act them out. 
                Who can guess which word?
ash- dusty wood remains after burning   cash- money
splash-water moving through the air      flash- bright light
trash- waste material to be thrown away mash- crush

Pictures : SH 

ash- dusty wood remains after burning   cash- money
splash-water moving through the air      flash- bright light
trash- waste material to be thrown away mash- crush
  
1. Play a matching game with these words on small cards. 
   Hold them up when you see the correct picture.
2. Play hang-man using the words.
3. Make up short skits (in small groups of 3) using these words.
4. Make a song or funny story with these rhyming words.

Vocabulary-3: CH 
Again, review our h sounds at end of words:
h (huffing sound)  sh (shhhhh)    ch (like a train) 
  gh (silent ending)  th (tongue between teeth) ph (sounds like f)

Let's explore words ending in CH.
Find out what CH sounds like. Make a train of students in the room
   and make the sound of a CH train.
Find meanings for each of the following words in your dictionary 
     in small groups. 
Draw pictures in your copybook.

Vocabulary-3: CH endings 
                  ch  (sounds like a train- choo choo)
FIND THE MATCHING PICTURES IN THE NEXT SLIDES.

ARCH- curved line,bridge or structure   STITCH- sewing
CHURCH- a place of worship              ITCH-A skin irritation 
ATTACH- put things together,connect   MATCH- find two things alike        
BATCH -a group of like items (cookies)  PERCH- a bird landing spot  
SCRATCH - skin wound or... with fingers or claws for an itch!
CATCH -receive (ball) with your hand  
MARCH- moving together in a line or... the month!

Pictures and Games: CH 

1. Match the pictures with your new CH words.
2. Write your new words in your copy books with pictures.
3. Make flash cards and play games guessing and matching.
4. Find which CH words rhyme. Make a matching game.
5. Act out each word to the class. Can they guess your word?

        Can you make up your own games with CH?

VOCABULARY 4:  TH at the end of words 

Let's explore the TH blend sound (tongue between teeth and blow).
TH can be at the beginning or end of words. 
Let's look at words ending in TH.
TOOTH-  MOUTH-   MYTH-   MATH-   FORTH-  SLOTH-
YOUTH-  SOUTH-   WITH-   PATH-     NORTH-  MOTH- 
 
 LISTEN TO THESE WORDS. WHICH WORDS RHYME?
LET'S find WHAT THEM in pictures.
IN THE FOLLOWING PICTURES, FIND EACH.

PICTURES:  TH at the end of words 

These TH words have pictures to show their meaning.

Two of the pictures have two words. Can you find them?
Match words with pictures.
Who can match them all?

VOCABULARY 5: PH at beginning or end of words 
WHAT sound does ph blend make?
It sounds like Ff.

CAN YOU MATCH these English ph words with their definitions?

PHOTOGRAPH         _________ another word for doctor
PHONE                _________ a devise for talking
PHONICS             _________ a picture taken with a camera
PHARMACY           _________ the study of letters and sounds
PHYSICIAN          _________ a place to get medicine

PICTURES : PH at beginning or end of words 
PH SOUNDS LIKE F.

Look at all the following pictures with PH at the beginning or end
of words.
  One has ph at both ends.    Can you find it?

Act out each word. 
Can others guess which word?

VOCABULARY 6: GH at the end of words 
Review all your blended H sounds.
Now learn how GH sounds at the end of words.

     1. Say the words below after your teacher.
     2. Find out what they mean in pictures following.
     3. Play a matching game with words and definitions on cards.
Some sound like "Ff".               Some are silent.
           Rough                            Weigh
           Tough                            High
           Cough                            Dough
           Laugh                            Thigh

Pictures: GH words  

Let's explore pictures of these new words with GH at the end.

Sometimes GH sounds like F. Sometimes there is no sound.

Can you match the words on the board with the pictures?
Can you use the words in a small sentence?
Can you tell your partner what each word sounds like?

Exploration : GAMES using new Hh words 
Try these activities:

A) Pairs: make up a story using new words & share with your class.
B) Draw pictures that identify words in your copybook.
C) With partner,listen to "Looma "speaks" the word. 
    Repeat the words together.
D) Make up games: rhyming words,  flash cards words,
E) Act out  new words and have the class guess them.
F) Use new words in a question. Reply using the words.

Review and Assess Your Learning 


Can your name 10 Hh words? 5 blends?
What is the difference between English and Nepali Hh sounds ?
How many Hh sounds at the end of words can you remember? 
In a small group, make a list of H, SH, CH, TH, PH, GH WORDS.
Compare with other groups? Who has the most?
Which are your favorite words?

Reflections on Hh sounds and words 

Ask the students to review what they learned.
-->What did you learn about different sounds of H? 
-->Look at your copybook Hh pages- 
       do you have all your pictures for the new words?
-->How would you explain the Hh sounds at the beginning and 
       end of words to your friends?
-->What questions do you have? 
-->What is most difficult to remember?
